üöÄ Day 12: Building a - Highly Available Web Application in AWSToday marks the final day of my AWS Quest in Cloud Practitioner journey! üôå I wrapped things up by learning how to design and deploy a highly available web application using key AWS services.üîπ Key Takeaways: ‚úÖ Multi-AZ Deployment ‚Äì Keeping applications running even if one zone fails üåç ‚úÖ Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) ‚Äì Distributes traffic across healthy resources ‚öñÔ∏è ‚úÖ Auto Scaling Groups ‚Äì Adjust capacity based on demand üìà ‚úÖ Amazon RDS (Multi-AZ) ‚Äì Ensures high availability at the database level üõ¢Ô∏è ‚úÖ S3 + CloudFront ‚Äì Serving static content globally with low latency üåêHigh availability = better reliability, performance, and user experience. üöÄ Day 12: Building a - Highly Available Web Application in AWSToday marks the final day of my AWS Quest in Cloud Practitioner journey! üôå I wrapped things up by learning how to design and deploy a highly available web application using key AWS services.üîπ Key Takeaways: ‚úÖ Multi-AZ Deployment ‚Äì Keeping applications running even if one zone fails üåç ‚úÖ Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) ‚Äì Distributes traffic across healthy resources ‚öñÔ∏è ‚úÖ Auto Scaling Groups ‚Äì Adjust capacity based on demand üìà ‚úÖ Amazon RDS (Multi-AZ) ‚Äì Ensures high availability at the database level üõ¢Ô∏è ‚úÖ S3 + CloudFront ‚Äì Serving static content globally with low latency üåêHigh availability = better reliability, performance, and user experience. üöÄ Day 12: Building a - Highly Available Web Application in AWSToday marks the final day of my AWS Quest in Cloud Practitioner journey! üôå I wrapped things up by learning how to design and deploy a highly available web application using key AWS services.üîπ Key Takeaways: ‚úÖ Multi-AZ Deployment ‚Äì Keeping applications running even if one zone fails üåç ‚úÖ Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) ‚Äì Distributes traffic across healthy resources ‚öñÔ∏è ‚úÖ Auto Scaling Groups ‚Äì Adjust capacity based on demand üìà ‚úÖ Amazon RDS (Multi-AZ) ‚Äì Ensures high availability at the database level üõ¢Ô∏è ‚úÖ S3 + CloudFront ‚Äì Serving static content globally with low latency üåêHigh availability = better reliability, performance, and user experience. üöÄ Day 12: Building a - Highly Available Web Application in AWSToday marks the final day of my AWS Quest in Cloud Practitioner journey! üôå I wrapped things up by learning how to design and deploy a highly available web application using key AWS services.üîπ Key Takeaways: ‚úÖ Multi-AZ Deployment ‚Äì Keeping applications running even if one zone fails üåç ‚úÖ Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) ‚Äì Distributes traffic across healthy resources ‚öñÔ∏è ‚úÖ Auto Scaling Groups ‚Äì Adjust capacity based on demand üìà ‚úÖ Amazon RDS (Multi-AZ) ‚Äì Ensures high availability at the database level üõ¢Ô∏è ‚úÖ S3 + CloudFront ‚Äì Serving static content globally with low latency üåêHigh availability = better reliability, performance, and user experience.
